pull.title: ci: Update GitHub Actions CI vcpkg cache on MSBuild update
pull.body:
On master (0cda5573405d75d695aba417e8f22f1301ded001) Visual Studio update in GitHub Actions CI virtual environment could break a build as the `vcpkg` cache is not updated accordingly (see #17788).

This PR:
- force vcpkg cache update on MSBuild update
- is an alternative to #17789
- fixes #17788

Server 2019 (windows-latest) virtual environment.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17789](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17789.html) (Update Qt binaries for GitHub Action CI job by sipsorcery)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Update Qt binaries for GitHub Action CI job
issue.body:
Also add new job version flag to allow vcpkg dependencies to be reinstalled whenever the job version flag is bumped.

Fix for #17788.

events.body:
ACK 0b5a366bd70119b34b112825d69804057141535f

Hopefully this is the last time we have to "fix" a CI that the project doesn't actually use directly.

issue.title: ci: Migration from AppVeyor to GitHub Actions
issue.body:
From the IRC [meeting on 2019-12-12](http://www.erisian.com.au/meetbot/bitcoin-core-dev/2019/bitcoin-core-dev.2019-12-12-19.01.log.html) log:

> 19:08:17 \<wumpus\> #topic appveyor CI future (sipsorcery)
> ...
> 19:25:14 \<wumpus\> in any case, let'stest it and talk about it next meeting or so
> 19:25:26 \<MarcoFalke\> Ok, so unless there are objections: Merge #17736 as short term fix, and then (next week maybe) switch to GitHub Actions CI?
> 19:25:28 \<gribble\> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17736 | Update msvc build for Visual Studio 2019 v16.4 by sipsorcery  Pull Request #17736  bitcoin/bitcoin  GitHub
> 19:25:41 \<sipsorcery\> +1
> 19:25:49 \<fanquake\> +1
> 19:25:49 \<wumpus\> ack
> 19:25:52 \<emilengler\> +1

Is it time to set up a CI workflow in this repo?

Pros: see meeting log.
Cons: to be built successfully a PR should be rebased on top of #17793.

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

issue.title: [CI] Implement Github Actions building for Dash
issue.body:
See bitcoin#17697, bitcoin#17726, bitcoin#17735 and bitcoin#17793 (note there may be other relevant PRs)

The same idea should be implemented for Dash, potentially reusing code / workflows as needed
